Key Match Events: Framber Valdez virtually kept pace amid a pitching duel.
Manny Machado broke a scoreless tie in the sixth with his second home run in two days.
Fernando Tatis Jr., Machado and Donovan Solano combined to hit San Diego's first trio of back-to-back-to-back homers in 27 years.
Pre-Game Insights: The Padres' rotation has pitched to a 2.44 ERA since Sept. 1.
Manny Machado has hit.323 since July 27 with 16 home runs in that span, tied for the second-most in the majors.
No one has supplied more RBIs than Machado's 50 since July 27.
Post-Match Reflections: Manny Machado expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
Mike Shildt highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was part of a series decider.
The Padres are 27-1 this season when Machado drives in more than one run.
The Padres are 3 1/2 games behind the first-place Los Angeles Dodgers, with a three-game visit to Dodger Stadium scheduled next week.
The Padres have a 2 1/2-game lead over Arizona in the race for the National League's top wild-card spot.
Others: The Padres are 5 games away from clinching a postseason berth.
